column4: What happens when you plug your mp3 player in, bernier? Does it show up as a generic USB device?
wait ill do it and tell you exactly
@spec:  http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/showthread.php?t=258719
googling works wonders for simple queries lilke this :)
yes it shows up as a usb device
in that case, just try opening it up?
you may have to browse a folder or two
i can also open it and there's many files in it which i dont know what they're used to
but with many mp3 devices, it's simply a matter of dragging and dropping
it aint that with the sony's
hmm...no sign of your music files then bernier? bet that lousy software converts it somehow...aargh, this is why free formats are wonderful ;)
I'll see what I can look up
yes it does convert it to ATRACT3plus
alright
have a look at this link:
http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=134122&highlight=sony+mp3+player
ok shamrock_uk hoep it's good news :P
well, just wondering if that links to a different Sony programme
if not, you could try CrossOver Office - they offer a 30-day trial and might work

@berner, if you're still here. You have two possible options - 1) You can try encoding the files yourself, as per these instructions:  http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/showthread.php?t=331135&highlight=sony+mp3
2) Someone has suggested reformatting the thing as FAT...but perhaps not such a good idea as it may end up unusable
@Chamwork: pick a walkthrough depending on your graphics card: http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=148351
it didn't work =/ thanks anyway. It's all because of that piece of crap called sonicstage =/ even with windows it sucks
